content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
--------------------
No new structures have been successfully placed on the map. Although several steps attempted to place a Lab at (0.5, 2.5), none succeeded because the lab item was not available in inventory. All final outputs confirm that no entities exist on the map.

ERROR TIPS
----------
• API Invocation Errors with get_entities  
 – Using get_entities({Prototype.Lab}, Position(x=0.5, y=2.5), radius=5) produced an error due to the unexpected keyword argument “radius”.  
 – A later call with three positional arguments (Position and a numeric value) also failed because the API did not expect any arguments.  
  Tip: Verify the function signature and supply only those parameters that are supported.

• Lab Placement Failures  
 – Multiple attempts to place a Lab at (0.5, 2.5) failed because no lab is available in the inventory.  
  Tip: Always confirm that the required structure item is present in your inventory before attempting placement.

• Iteration over a NoneType  
 – When filtering for labs (by iterating over the result of get_entities), the code encountered a “NoneType is not iterable” error.  
  Tip: Ensure that, if no entities are found, the returned value is safely handled (for example, by defaulting to an empty list) rather than being None.

• Lab Crafting Resource Chain Issues  
 – Crafting attempts for the Lab failed due to missing sub-ingredients. Initial errors pointed out shortages of iron-gear-wheels (stemming from an insufficient iron-plate supply) and later, missing components (such as iron-gear-wheel x2).  
 – Additionally, failures in producing necessary intermediate items (like copper-cable and electronic-circuit) indicate gaps in the production chain.  
  Tip: Before initiating lab crafting, verify that all prerequisites in the production chain (e.g., sufficient iron-plates, copper-plates, and the ability to smelt or assemble sub-ingredients) are in place and adequately stocked.
